Just got this from Steffen as well.  We should have a fix ready soon.  

You're seeing this on Windows XP??  I thought we were covered with concurrency tests there.
Yes, I'm using Windows XP SP2.

Anything else interesting in your Eclipse, e.g. WTP?

I haven't been able to reproduce, but a dev build with lazier UI extension point loading is uploading right now and should be available within 15 min.  Please let me know how the update goes.
Well, I have all Callisto + a lot of other plugins :)
OK, will try to reproduce with all of Callisto.
I can't reproduce with Callisto, and previous build.  Willian: please hold off from installing the dev build yet, Steffen is iterating on me with this and there could still be a bug.

Strange, I closed Eclipse because I had to run some heavy processing, and after that, when I started again, this bug didn't happen...

But opening another workspace it happened; apparently this is not a deterministic bug...

BTW, taking a quick look at the stack trace (I have not the mylar source code in my machine here at work), I see that it is occurring because ImageRegistry constructor is being called from a non-UI thread in the plugin initialization; in this case the ImageRegistry should be created using "new ImageRegistry(PlatformUI.getWorkbench().getDisplay())" or something like that.

I think this should fix the problem.
OK, 0.7.0.v20061020-1600 should be available within 10min, and should solve this bug.  But I need to know if you notice any other race conditions (i.e. errors/warnings in the log).

Willian: I moved that whole initialization out of the start() method.  The problem is that Eclipse initialization of extension points can trigger a race/condition bug even when the dependencies are correct.  We've always had to work-around this bug and changing our startup order can re-trigger it on some VMs.

Steffen confirmed the fix.  

Willian: could you try it out and let me know how it is on your Callisto set up?  Version is 0.7.0.v20061020-1600
Great.  Just as a sanity check could you restart your workbench a couple of times?
Done many times in 2 workspaces. Appears to be OK for now.
